title: Söderstadion
text:
Söderstadion "(translated in English as Southern Stadium)" was a <a href="association%20football">football</a> and <a href="bandy">bandy</a> <a href="stadium">stadium</a> in <a href="Stockholm">Stockholm</a>, <a href="Sweden">Sweden</a>. It was opened in 1966 and closed in 2013, being replaced by nearby <a href="Tele2%20Arena">Tele2 Arena</a>.
Söderstadion had a capacity of 12,800 depending on usage. A record attendance of 22,000 was set on 31 October 1982, when <a href="Hammarby%20Fotboll">Hammarby IF</a> faced <a href="IFK%20G%C3%B6teborg">IFK Göteborg</a>.
There had already existed stadiums at the site, the earliest opened in 1918 under the name <a href="Johanneshovs%20Idrottsplats">Johanneshovs Idrottsplats</a>. After the stadium was closed, the site will now be used for new apartment buildings.
<a href="Bandy">Bandy</a> was played at Söderstadion wintertime until 1989 and the overall . The <a href="Bandy%20World%20Championship%201987">Bandy World Championship 1987</a> final was played here (2nd half of the video). The last bandy match at the stadium was the <a href="List%20of%20Swedish%20bandy%20championship%20finals%20%281950%E2%80%931999%29%231989">Swedish final of 1989</a>.
The home team <a href="Hammarby%20IF%20Bandy">Hammarby</a>, the 2010 and 2013 Swedish champions, now plays at <a href="Zinkensdamm">Zinkensdamm</a>.
The arena has also been used for <a href="ice%20hockey">ice hockey</a>.
Replacement.
Before the Stockholm municipal elections of 2006, the right wing parties of Stockholm stated that a new stadium would be built if the municipal elections were won. On 28 June 2007 plans for a <a href="Tele2%20Arena">new stadium</a> were officially announced. The last football game at Söderstadion was played on the 23 June 2013 when <a href="Hammarby%20IF">Hammarby IF</a> played against Ängelholms FF in the 13th round of <a href="Superettan">Superettan</a>. The game ended 1–1 with Hammarby securing a late draw when <a href="Kennedy%20Bakircioglu">Kennedy Bakircioglu</a> scored the last goal at Söderstadion.
Trivia.
The stadium is mentioned by its old name in the movie <a href="My%20Life%20as%20a%20Dog">My Life as a Dog</a> (1985), where the main character tells the audience of a motorcycle <a href="accident">accident</a> that occurred during a motorcycle show performed there. The stadium is located just next to the <a href="Ericsson%20Globe">Ericsson Globe</a>. It is most easily reached from the <a href="Stockholm%20metro">Stockholm metro</a> stations <a href="Gullmarsplan%20metro%20station">Gullmarsplan</a> or <a href="Globen%20metro%20station">Globen</a>.
